newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Sri Lanka sells naphtha to Tomen at Sing -88 cts/b.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka sells naphtha to Tomen at Sing -88 cts/b.

text.p: Sri Lanka's state-owned Ceylon Petroleum Corp (CPC) has awarded a tender to sell 110,000-125,000 barrels of light naphtha to Japanese trader Tomen at 88 cents per barrel below Singapore quotes, a company official said on Thursday.
The tender closed March 18 and was valid until March 20.
It offered the cargo on a free-on-board (fob) basis from Colombo lifting March 24-25.
"The price is lower than the last award because the tender was on short notice... the cargo loads next week," the official said.
In its last tender, CPC sold 25,000 tonnes of naphtha at 73 cents below Singapore quotes lifting January 20-21, fob Colombo.
